titleStmt.title: Whereas we have been necessarily occasioned to take especial notice, that His Majesties revenue arising by hearths, firing places and stoves within this kingdom, hath of late become very much impaired, and still continues deeply in arrear ... by the Lord Lieutenant and Council, Ormonde.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Lieutenant (1661-1669 : Ormonde)
Ormonde, James Butler, Duke of, 1610-1688.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Crooke ... and are to besold [sic] by Samuel Dancer ...,

notesStmt.note: Title from first 6 lines of text.
Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
Date of publication suggested by Wing.
"Given at the Council chamber in Dublin, the 21 day of March, 1666" [1667]--leaf [2]
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
